website_summaries.verdict: An elegant yet durable two-tone automatic timepiece that is suitable for all occasions.
pros: Powered by a Seiko NH35A automatic movement (which you can see through the back of the watch), so no batteries are required
cons: The power reserve is poor, if you don't wear it for a few hours, it needs to be reset

customer_reviews.title: An very good automatic watch for less than $100
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I'm surprised by the quality and feel of this watch. I bought it for my kid, since he likes my Submariner (but i can't afford to buy a teenager that), expecting a decent watch for $80. It went above my expectations, it looks very nice, doesn't look cheap, the band is a bit in the heavier side compared to my watch, but he changed it to a Perlon NATO strap. Overall you can't go wrong with this, I'm even going to order an Invicta for myself!
customer_reviews.author: ROBB.O

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great as always. This is my third Invicta watch. Love the solid links. Cuts down on corrosion see on semihollow folded links in other watches. Adds weight, but not significant. Came with the yellow colored rotor. If the movement isn't running on time, give it a couple of weeks off wear, it should stabilize. Can't beat the classy look of a sweeping second hand. Easy to adjust the size via link removal. Came with outer white box and OEM yellow Invicta box. All the original plastic protective coverings. Cyclops magnifier is right on center with the date window. Extremely beautiful watch for the price.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 1 watch and the stem was stuck shut.i ordered another and the stem was stuck just like the first.So Now I washed for my money back. You need to check the watches before they go to a customer.
customer_reviews.author: Bald and beautiful

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch
customer_reviews.text: Upon reading reviews from many Invicta owners, I've decided you either love them, or hate them. I'm a vintage watch guy, and the Invicta/Seiko automatic movement sounded interesting. I decided on the Pro Diver 40mm, and love it. Most Invictas are too large for me, but the 40mm is just right. Have worn pretty much every day for the last 3-4 weeks, and it keeps excellent time. Some of the negative reviews I think are from those not familiar with a watch with an automatic movement. If you don't wear every day, it will run down. It's early, but so far I am extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful watch, the the Plating on the band dissapates after FOUR MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely upset to find out that a watch that is four months old the gold plating on the band dissipates after four months. The watch it self-works great and is flashy, however this was a replacing a 10-year-old Citizen that that plating never dissipated. I contacted the manufacturer letting them know what happened and they recommend me contacting amazon which won't let me, so I am going to leave it here. A watch plating should not dissipate after four months in an office environment. There must be a design defect and I would like this to be addressed.
customer_reviews.author: ChEwW

customer_reviews.title: it was advertised as a new watches but the box-case both inside and outside material was dirty. The watches also had serious damage on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Upon receipt these watches were with several defections: it was advertised as a new watches but the box-case both inside and outside material was dirty. The watches also had serious damage on the glass cracked to be exact. There were several scratches on metal bracelet, aswell as on the clockface.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My watch did not work for very long. An expensive disposable watch.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is very impressive and I got a lot of comments on it. But less than 2 years later it loses 5 minutes in less than an hour and a half. I synchronized these 2 watches at 4:00 pm. Too bad. I'll stick with the Casio, which costs about the same, is over 12 years old and is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this watch
customer_reviews.text: I have had this watch for 6 months and the glass has started fogging up already. Called there warranty dept and I would have to pay the freight to them and they are going to charge me also 28.00 for the freight back to me to repair it. I would not recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a beautiful watch! Just doesn't keep good time.
customer_reviews.text: I wish that I had seen this watch in a quartz model before I bought it in the automatic model, because of the shutdown mode after 8 hours as my partner usually sleeps 9 hours at night. But it is a beautiful looking watch. This watch loses about 3-4 minutes every day, in the less than a month my boyfriend has had it, he has become very unhappy with it.
customer_reviews.author: auntiewe

customer_reviews.title: Can't wind it, automatic mechanism is pathetic
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received would hardly work at all, despite wearing it on my wrist all day, as another reviewer suggested. You can't wind it by hand either. So, Amazon sent me a replacement, which worked for about 7 hours, then stopped. I was wearing it all this time, and continued to wear it, but it never started moving again. My opinion: junk mechanism. I returned this one too, and bought a Henry Jay quartz watch that looks almost identical, works perfectly, is more visible in the dark, and has a better quick release band, which is also the perfect size for my wrist. If the quality control is this bad, I cannot recommend the brand.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Battery is dead after 3 days
customer_reviews.text: I expected my brand new Invicta Men's 8928OB Pro Diver Gold Stainless Steel Two-Tone Automatic Watch to last at least a year before having to replace the battery, but mine went dead after 3 days. I don't feel comfortable buying a battery and changing it myself, so now I have to find a watch shop, take the time to drive there and back, and wait while it's being replaced. Since I work from home, I don't drive to work every day, so replacing the battery isn't as simple as it sounds. I like the watch, looks nice, but the dead battery turned my experience into a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Slapshot

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking watch
customer_reviews.text: I like watches and own 20+. Some are Smart, some are GPS enabled, some are expensive dress, and others are inexpensive knock-around. This Invicta falls into the nice casual Friday category. It's a good looking watch designed after the Rolex Sub-Mariner. I'm at a point in my life that I could actually afford a Rolex. But, then I think why would I want a 4-5 figure status symbol on my wrist that tells the exact same time as a $10 Timex. Hey, if your ego demands it, no judgement. The Invicta has heavy solid build to it. It's accurate IF worn daily for the self-winding feature. And the price is very modest. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: F.B.

customer_reviews.title: Failed afer 4 months!
customer_reviews.text: I initially liked the watch initially then the date stopped working. I inquired about repair they want $28 money order to be sent in to repair Free. What? 33% of the watch price to perform a free repair. I would never re-order this watch and this is my first BAD AMAZON experience. I got to comfortable with Amazon and thought they backed their products - while it is the watch brand failure I also believe Amazon should ensure a better experience.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Mangold

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy invicta watches!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 invicta watches I liked the first one when the first quit working I got this watch out of box for the first time. Won’t keep time, can’t set date, the worst watch I’ve ever bought. I’ll never buy invicta again.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Eddings

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous Watch
customer_reviews.text: I have been collecting mid-range watches for a few years. This is one of the cheaper watches I've purchased in the past few years, but I don't regret it at all. I bought this one as it looks like a Rolex I can't quite afford yet. It is beautiful. Perfect size, elegant yet simple. The second hand sweep is clean with barely noticeable ticks. Have only worn it once and received more compliments than other watches I've worn frequently. Stylish choice for any wardrobe. If you're on a budget, this watch is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 100 times more beautiful than in pictures
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying this watch is 100 times better looking than pictures can show, it is amazing how beautiful and well crafted this watch is, and I got it a day earlier than expected, the weight is just perfect, is not to heavy like a brick, and not to little like a knock off, the size is perfect for me , the bracelet is gorgeous!!, I don’t see my self changing it any time soon, if you ask me if I recommend this watch, the answer is a solid YES!!!, and the price!! Unbeatable!!, just get it, you will not regretted 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: DJ KARLOS

customer_reviews.title: Heck of a good value. Has Seiko NH35A automatic self-winding movement with ...
customer_reviews.text: Heck of a good value. Has Seiko NH35A automatic self-winding movement with hacking (stopping the second hand for synchronization) and manual winding (when the watch dies from lack of use). Perfect 40mm diameter for my 7 inch wrist. Nicely finished all stainless steel case. Keeps time plus or minus 5 seconds a day, water resistant to 200 meters. Lume and bracelet ok, as is mineral glass face. Applied markers and coin-edged aluminum bezel good. A little gritty in crown threads. Can be worn for dress or business casual. Great entry automatic watch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Watch runs slow.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a month ago. Problems: First, the watch runs slow, about two minutes a day. I can perhaps tolerate that. Second: A more serious problem: Looking my watch early this morning showed that this watch had stopped dead a couple of hours earlier. Yes, a good shaking started its movement for the time being. This watch was purchased about a month ago and it has been worn 100% of the time. I have had many automatic watches, such as a Tissot, but never have I had these two problems. My Tissot ran accurately and never stopped unless I removed it from my wrist and left it stationary for a day or so. A pity
customer_reviews.author: Reece Thomas Harris

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep time.
customer_reviews.text: Does not keep good time. This watch gains 5 minutes a week or so. That's horrible for a timepiece today. Piece of junk. Edited: This watch just keeps getting faster. Will not keep time for one day anymore. Also the hasp on the band is impossible to open if you don't have fingernails. Would even be hard if you do. This watch sucks and should not be sold. I will NEVER buy this brand of watch again. Out of frustration with this watch I purchased a $20.00 Casio which actually keeps time much better!
customer_reviews.author: Gerfnad

customer_reviews.title: I returned this watch after 3 days kept stopping can't see what time in the dark
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a new rolex submariner I gave to my son when I stopped my windsurfing and sailing. this is nearly it's equal I paid $14,000 in Newport Beach for the real deal ROLEX SUBMARINER, this is nearly it's equal for a fraction of the cost I purchased the extra cost 4 year warranty for less than $5.00 I'd had some bad experiences with Seiko in the past, I believe they were fakes even though seller declared otherwise. watch handsome and manly I have a ROLEX PRESIDENT THAT I RARELY WEAR IT IS SO OSTENTACIOUS . LOVE THIS WATCH TOO BAD THEY HAVEN'T USED QUALITY LUMINATION SUBSTANCE ON DIAL OH WELL
customer_reviews.author: bill Leland

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is incredible value for the money. It is almost identical to its higher end counterpart. Matches the dial color to a tee, that is very hard to do. The movement is a NH35 Seiko and is know as a workhorse. It keeps better time than some of my other more expensive watches. Really like the color of gold. I’m not worried about it flaking off or tarnishing. I’d buy 10 more but they’re so well made you only need one.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rolex Submariner homage
customer_reviews.text: Perfect water resistance, dove down to 55 meters without any issue. After 2 years the bezel got jammed and in an effort to repair it I damaged it and decided to order the same watch again. Surprisingly after 2 years of wear the gold plating did not tarnished but the blue of the bezel faded. The caliber Seiko NH35 is a workhorse, has a hack, speed date, and can be accurately adjusted with a plastic toothpick (to not magnetize the hairspring) to an average of 5 sec a day.
customer_reviews.author: Jean M.

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY AT A PRICE...
customer_reviews.text: Watch arrived within two days and beautifully packaged as well as protected with covering film. It really looks quite nice and is "hefty" and seems to be very well made. After 4 days of wearing the watch, it appears to not have even lost or gained a second. Needed to remove two links (local jeweler did it for ten bucks) and it fits perfectly. This watch has the "sporty" Rolex Submariner look and yet with the two-tone gold and silver band is equally appropriate as a dress watch. Very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for under$100. It’s not a Rolex...just a good looking watch!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok...I bought a Rolex back in 1969 when they were under $150 in an Air Force BX. It has migrated from my wrist to my safe over the past 50 years due to it’s ridiculous value. This watch (Invicta) keeps good time, resembles a Rolex to some degree (which does not bother me) and is a good buy for the price. In fact, the quality for this price is unheard of. I love mine but I do not compare it to a Rolex...it’s not! It’s just a good watch for the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: PURPLE PURPLE PURPLE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I returned both the automatic and quartz options of this otherwise beautiful watch!! The reason? BOTH had PURPLE dials. The watch face is not even a shade of Blue. It is in your face purple. So beware the description is so wrong and should be changed immediately. I do go back and gleaned the reviews and this seems to be the case for some time now. IF it becomes available with a true BLUE dial I would definitely give it another try.
customer_reviews.author: DVH

customer_reviews.title: "Hey nice Rolex!"  "It's a $100 knockoff, but thanks!"
customer_reviews.text: As someone who aspired to study sharks, I've always wanted a Rolex Submariner Date watch. I saw this Invicta and decided I didn't have $13K to drop on a precision timepiece, and this would have to do. I'm constantly complimented on my watch, as most people think it's a Submariner, and I use it as an everyday watch and don't have to worry about scratches or beating it up. The perpetual motion works well and if not used in 24 hours you will have to readjust time. For a sub $100 timepiece, even if worn everyday, it has to be adjusted once a month, usually advanced anywhere from 7-12 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: RFarino

customer_reviews.title: A quick glance at this watch and you'd swear you ...
customer_reviews.text: A quick glance at this watch and you'd swear you were looking at a Rolex GMT. The dial, calendar bubble and blue bezel are magnificent. As a timepiece, the self winding mechanism compliments the beauty of a sweep second hand that moves with a fluid grace as opposed to click-click-click of an electronic movement. Once again Invicta scores. This is my fifth Invicta, now surpassing Bulova as the brand most represented in my collection. Number one is my Movado Esperanza and Invicta holds the next 3 spots. For the price, this is a superb addition to the amateur's collection.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Michael Pavesi

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but not cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I work in powersports sales and I'm constantly on motorcycles, atvs, and watercraft in Florida. This watch has been great so far. Finish is holding up nice and the watch is easy to read at a glance. The glass has been very scratch resistant and wipes clean easly. Only issue I have is the date setting in the dial does not work correctly. Only reason I didn't give it a 5 star rating. For a cheap automatic watch its very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy and very difficult at first to try and set time
customer_reviews.text: I just received this watch. It looks very nice but it is very heavy. I am not sure if I am going to keep it or not. I also have to get it sized but that is understandable. I had a really hard time to try and pull out the wind button / knob(?). I had to pull really hard and was afraid that I might break the knob. It finally worked but the watch is way too heavy and quite large for my hand. It is good for younger audience.
customer_reviews.author: Koo

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the craftsmanship and quality of the watch. The watch is very classy looking and definitely a conversation starter. To my suprise the band is also made a a very sturdy material as well. I would definitely recommend this to anyone that is interested in quality watches as a reasonable price. On a side note, I have a smaller wrist (6.5in.) and I think the watch looks perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Simply Brilliant!!!
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me! I bought this watch for $78.99, not including tax, I am beyond blown away with it's looks. It's absolutely stunning and gorgeous!!! I've had it for just (5) days, but it keeps excellent time! it is well constructed with a nice weight and feel! What a lot of folks do not realize, Invicta has been manufacturing time pieces for well over (180) years. As compared to other watches in this price range, the 8928O is top notch! If you love watches like I do, get this one! It will soon become your favorite!!!
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Valentin

customer_reviews.title: Dial look purple
customer_reviews.text: The watch looks nice but the dial looks purple especially compared to the bezel insert. It would be nice if the dial matched the bezel insert. Overall quality is good and I've worn this and other Invicta watches in the ocean and pool, never had an issue with the water resistance. Build quality is good and it keeps time well. Haven't had any issues with scratches or the gold plating fading
customer_reviews.author: Eric F

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous timepiece which runs a little bit fast.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent craftsmanship! I have about 2 dozen watches. This watch's appearance matches top quality Swiss watches. No surprise since it is virtually a very good replica of a Rolex, except the brand. Unfortunately, Its precision does not quite match Swiss standard, which is +6 ~ -3 seconds per day. The one I got has been gaining 15 seconds per day in the past couple of days since I received it. It is too soon to tell by now. So I won't reduce a star of the initial deficiency of precision. I will update my review in a while.
customer_reviews.author: nusaco888Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This watch looks great but is absolutely garbage. The one I have gets stuck at 3 o’clock every day it does not glow in the dark and the date will not change when the watch gets to 12 o’clock at night. Looks great does not work at all if you want something just to look at this watch is great if you want to tell time it’s better to go to Walmart and buy a $20 Casio. Invicta is supposed to mean invincible I think it means overpriced junk.
customer_reviews.author: Robert 0421

customer_reviews.title: Didnt last long dont buy
customer_reviews.text: This product lasts me 8 months. Was too late to return it. It stopped working. I dont think I would ever buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall nice watch...works well and looks good when new.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice overall - has good weight and is accurate, reliable, and looks very similar to the watch after which it was designed. Screw down crown, good quality movement. Only issue is that the gold plating which is pretty thin on the band is starting to wear off after normal wear after just a few months of wearing a couple days a week. You can see it is only on one side where I rest my hand on my desk when typing. Otherwise I like it a lot. Too bad about the wear issue
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Accurate watech.
customer_reviews.text: Look good, Durable, Accurate Time, Easy to adjust time or date. Just screw crown counterclockwise, pulls out crown one notch to adjust date, pulls out crown second notches to adjust time. Can withstand water dept as stated, bracelet easy to adjust to the right size for your wrist size. I gave a rating of 5 stars for a Great Product.
customer_reviews.author: K C

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for !
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this watch and it arrived on time. I gave it 2 stars because the quality is not what I expected. I know I am used to Seiko and Citizen quality. If you pay 80.00 for a watch you get an 80.00 dollar watch. in other words you get what you pay for !! also the watch does not look as good as the photo online !! it's not bad. It is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: William Helms

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this watch for 2 1/2 weeks and it has only gained 11 seconds, much better than my 1986 Rolex that costs about $250 to have cleaned every couple of years. It looks great with the blue face and I’ve received several complements on it. I only buy watches I can wear in the shower and while swimming and this Invictis fits the bill. The price plus the design and quality equal amazing value. My wrists are very big, but I still had to remove a link - an easy task after watching a YouTube video.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Kelly

customer_reviews.title: A very nice watch bargain.
customer_reviews.text: I now own two of these watches, this plus the black face steel watch. I love both of them. I bought this at 59 which, in my opinion, is a great deal. These are among the best looking Invicta watches I've owned. It also is just heavy enough with a substantial band that makes it feel nice to wear. It looks and feels like a much more expensive watch. It's not as nice as the Tags and one Omega I've owned, but then again this didn't cost more than a grand either.
customer_reviews.author: JLB

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a beautiful watch. Had a link removed and a micro adjustment at a local jewelery store. I’m sure it can be done easily yourself. I can’t comment on scratch resistance yet or the wear factor being so new. I definitely think the size is acceptable, not too big and not too small. 4 stars only because I thought it was Swiss movement, my watch says Japan movement. Which is fine but slightly misleading in the description. $60 you can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Twilitegolf

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and works great
customer_reviews.text: This watch is beautiful! I have not had automatic watches before, but this one works great and keeps excellent time. I like that the knob screws in for security. The glass back allows you to see the watch gears. The "bubble" over the date amplifies it for easy reading. The band came a little large for me. For now I adjusted where it connects at the clasp and it is a reasonable fit. I will probably need to take it to a jeweler to remove a link or two. I think this will be one of my favorites of all time as long as it stays accurate.
customer_reviews.author: C Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: After wearing it only a few times you can start to see scratches on the face. But that’s normal although there is one scratch that bugs me Bc it’s right over the magnified glass that covex. Other than that. The gold plating is durable and doesn’t stain. High quality for price paid! P.s. if you don’t wear it for a while the gears stop moving so just a shake gets em working again
customer_reviews.author: chris palazis

customer_reviews.title: Love the watch
customer_reviews.text: Love the watch. Looks and wears great! Wear it everyday and every where. Withstanda fresh and salt water, although I did not recommended long periods of salt immersion. Keeps great time as well. Lots of compliments "is that a rolex...?" 4 starts causw of the 2 different blue dials. Inside is a deep blue the outside is a lighter royal blue. Was not in description of watch when purchased. Totally not a deal breaker. Have bought a few others since. Nice job Invicta and thank you.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Invicta watch!
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present for my husband. He loves Invicta watches and recently lost one I had bought him years ago. This was the best match I could find and it is actually nicer in person. Looks like a Rolex but without the price tag. I always read reviews and some said they had issues with time/date. We had no issues at all, just followed directions and all is good. It's still new so I will update if a thing changes. Highly recommend this watch and Invicta in general
customer_reviews.author: SI mom

customer_reviews.title: This is a very attractivewatch and looks like an expensive one
customer_reviews.text: This is a very attractive watch and looks like an expensive one! It has a nice heavy feel to it. It comes with a very large band, and I had to remove a couple of links, but that is GOOD for someone with a larger wrist. You just need to be aware of how this watch works, and I wasn't. The watch has no battery, and is run by your movement. So if you lay the watch down for a couple of days, it will stop, and you will have to reset it. It's no big deal, but we thought something was wrong because we had not thoroughly ready the description. Other than that, very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Carols

customer_reviews.title: like the first
customer_reviews.text: My second Invicta purchase is, like the first, a beautifully designed timepiece. This particular one is a chronograph like my Rolex. I have read some negative reviews about the Invicta product. My observation is that those negative reviews are from folks who did not read or understand the warrenty. The complaint about the length of time for service on the watches is about what one would expect for, especially a chronograph,(sometimes called "self-winding"). My Rolex was gone for two months for service and carried a $700.00 repair bill. I collect timepieces and I am totally pleased this watch. Quite eye catching. I will very likely purchase Invicta timepieces again, especially the chronograph models.
customer_reviews.author: Robert (Bob) Gossard

customer_reviews.title: Exellent Quality Watch!
customer_reviews.text: I received the watch and I like it very much. The quality is very good, heavy and durable. It is kind of big for my small wrist. This is a very dressy watch, beautiful! I never thought that it was a really nice looking watch . I was kind of reluctant to buy it at first, because when buying online, some times things look beautiful, but in reality is not what you see in the picture. I am very satisfy with the purchase. The watch has been working perfectly fine. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Zibbie

customer_reviews.title: You can NOT go wrong with this watch!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fabulous watch! Just as I imagined it would look and feel on my wrist. I am extremely happy with this watch! Cant say enough good things about it. I am surprised I paid less than $300 for this watch. It has the look and feel of a $3000 watch! You can not go wrong with the water proof . Just becareful wearing it in shaddy places! It looks and feels like most $6,000 + watches!
customer_reviews.author: William M.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Automatic Watch!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's really hard to believe how beautiful this watch really is! I own a number of other Invicta and Loreo automatic watches, and although I love them all, this is the best of the lot. Unlike many other Invicta watches, this one is a modest 40mm making it much a lighter and less "in your face" timepiece. The Japenese NH35A automatic movement is spot on accurate, something I, unfortunately, can not say about the Loreo watch as beautiful as they are. Easily rivals automatics costing several times what this beauty cost! Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: A. Landry

customer_reviews.title: Fantastically Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for 2 weeks, and I've been tracking the accuracy of its timekeeping daily against an atomic clock ap. Frankly, I'm astonished at how well it's done. Out of the box with no adjustments having been made, it is consistantly within ± 2 seconds/day of the atomic clock reading. That level of accuracy is comparable to the most expensive automatic mechanical watches (think Rolex) and is phenomenal for a budget watch.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid watch at a value.
customer_reviews.text: My 30+ year Rolex band is worn out. Didn't want to spend $$$$ on new bracelet. My Salt life requires a waterproof watch that can handle rugged activities. The double clasp and screw down crown are solid. The self winding is mechanism is smooth and the glass back is a novelty. The second hand movement is not that of a rolex but it is pretty smooth. Great watch to surf , fish, ski etc... If it breaks and you lose it your day isn"t ruined. The mineral crystal is still scratch free after 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: D4NT3 C1R0N3

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Piece
customer_reviews.text: What's NOT to like about this watch? It's beautiful, keeps great time, and it was $82! Ok, so it's not a Submariner. It never claimed to be! It's not a "fake" Rolex either. It has a brand name clearly printed on it...it says Invicta! All the negative remarks posted in some reviews here make me laugh. "It loses a few minutes a day" (here's a thought...ADJUST IT!). "It's obviously a fake Rolex" (nope...it's actually a genuine Invicta!). On and on they go. Hey...remember something: IT WAS $82!!! I have a Brietling, an Omega and and a Tag, and someday I will have a Submariner. But until then this Invicta will do. Just remember...$82!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Eye catching impressive appearance . Very accurate movement . All at an impressive low  price.
customer_reviews.text: An iconic Rolex Submariner design with a highly regarded automatic Japanese Seiko movement. A beautiful homage at an incredible price. Looks much more expensive than it is. Mine keeps excellent time that falls within COSC worthy accuracy requirements. Don’t forget to close the screw down crown to get water resistance as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great watch and also cheap look-a-like.
customer_reviews.text: I have a submariner Rolex that is in shop being refurbished. No one has noticed that I don't have my Rolex on anymore. This watch from 3 feet away looks and feels exactly the same. Color on face is not exact as elapsed time ring, but not a problem for the price. I may use this as a daily wear and only use Rolex for special occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Ghostrid3r

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience with this watch!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd time I bought this watch. We received it on April 16th and today on April 20th it's losing time @ 2 to 3 hours. The 2nd one only lasted a couple of days and did the same thing. The 1st 1 lasted a year and a couple months. He liked it so much that's why I bought more! At this point we are just disgusted with this Invicta watch!
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Graver

customer_reviews.title: After 3 years of every day wear it is still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch July 4, 2017. More then 3 years ago. I wear it every single day and it has never failed me. I wasn't a huge fan of Invicta but loved the look of this watch and decided to give it a try. I really didn't expect it to last this long but it really has been flawless. It has never been serviced, It still looks almost new, and has never given me a problem. I have always loved the look of it but didn't think I would actually get compliments on it. To my surprise I have received multiple compliments from complete strangers which has never happened before.
customer_reviews.author: Will Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Great looking watch
customer_reviews.text: To the casual eye, it looks very much like a Rolex. I have received far more compliments on THIS watch than I ever got on my Tag Heuer. And I don't have $10K plus to spend on a Rolex!This model doesn't keep precise time like a digital watch, but certainly close enough. For the looks alone, the price cannot be beat. I dropped my first one on the tile floor face down and cracked the Bezel. Didn't hesitate for a second to buy a second one. Do yourself a favor. Spend an additional $10.99 for a "Paxcoo Watchband tool Kit", also from Amazon. Makes adjusting the wrist band simple and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Safe Seas

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous watch for men or women
customer_reviews.text: Love the R*lex inspired look and the price tag! I’ve always liked Invicta watches and this one is very expensive looking. Included box etc as usual. The only annoying thing is having to reset it if you don’t wear it every day. Link easily removed with small screwdriver at home.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Works only when using it, energy saver mode
customer_reviews.text: Although very aesthetically pleasing, this is the first watch with a energy saver type function. It only works when you wear it and after you take it off and not wear it for at least 8hours the seconds hand stops and when you use it again have to reset the date and time to the current. Very odd but it is what it is
customer_reviews.author: Steven Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Invicta needs more love than hate
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Keeping good time and looks amazing. You can’t have incredible expectations for a watch in this price range but you get a lot: Seiko movement, great looking, windable and hackable. The lume is awful but was expected. My cyclops was actually aligned pretty well but the bezel not as much. I’m glad I at least got it with an aligned cyclops. Most people get neither but again, it’s an $80 watch.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: the product looks just a replica
customer_reviews.text: I chose to buy this product once again to give it as a gift, but the arrival watch is not even close to the first. First of all, the packaging differs, it does not show the hologram of the original product, it has many small scratches and the finish differs a lot from the first watch bought. cheap product at the same price
customer_reviews.author: Gelu

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful in the daytime
customer_reviews.text: It's really a great watch. My dad (who has been collecting watches since before I was born) admitted that at first glance he might have believed it was a Rolex. They've really nailed the appearance here. Getting the Seiko movement in it was a great decision as well, it only loses a few seconds a day. Only bad thing about it is the Lume. It's very weak on the hands, and almost nonexistent on the markers.. If you don't really care about that, go ahead and buy it. Otherwise, look into other options.
customer_reviews.author: LuckyStrikes

customer_reviews.title: Handsome watch at a fantastic price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch as a replacement for the one my husband currently wears (same model), if it should ever meet some unfortunate death. I absolutely love this watch on my husband. It looks great with his business and formal wear, and also works with his casual clothes. He wears it all the time, even swimming. He likes it because we don't have to worry about if the batteries will die, or winding. The minor cons are: It does lose two to five minutes a week. So, once a week he adjusts the time. Also, after 5 years of wear, on his current one, some of the gold plating has faded, but it's hardly noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Peng

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Have had two of this and neither one worked more than a couple of months
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch but color wasn't as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This Invicta watch was very nice. Nice two-tone finish, nice movement, nice bracelet, etc. The only problem was the color of the watch face. As advertised on Amazon, the face of the watch is a deep blue however, after I received it and examined it under different types of lights, the watchface is clearly purple. This was the only deal breaker for me. Had the face of the watch been a deep blue, I would have happily kept it. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep time. Looks great.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the watch was amazing. Looks amazing feels great. Love that it's automatic but very cheap movement. Had it about a month maybe less now it can't even keep time for a day barely had to send back. If u want just for looks it's good but keeping time it is not good with.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small watch
customer_reviews.text: If you are used to bigger watches or have a large wrist, don't buy this watch. I returned mine because the description says 40mm case and it is not! The one I got was 38mm. Maybe they mixed them up, but this is not the same size as a rolex. Nice watch for a woman, but small.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Read this review before you going to purchase these watches.
customer_reviews.text: They are garbage. They stopped working after two months and this is unacceptable because I see they have a Lotta good reviews . So I think most of those reviews are fake or purchase reviews. Do not waste your money especially if you’re buying gift for somebody because they’re not worth it. They just good looking watches but otherwise they’re going to stop working after a few months. I am very very disappointed and I almost purchased another Invicta watches .
customer_reviews.author: martin hric

customer_reviews.title: Best automatic watch under $100
customer_reviews.text: Very good watch for the money. It has a Seiko automatic movement which has been keeping very good time for me. It loses 5 seconds a day which is totally acceptable in the automatic watch realm. It’s also extremely easy to work on and would make a great starter piece for someone looking to get into watchmaking/customization. I plan on swapping the dial and hands out soon.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter Gary

customer_reviews.title: I liked my original so much that after it stopped working, I got a second
customer_reviews.text: My first 8928OB lasted six years. The first day I wore it, a lady I often saw on the commuter train purred, "Your watch is beautiful." Eventually it stopped moving reliably (and now doesn't move at all), and it might have lasted longer had I kept in a watch winder. Still, it was a good value for what I paid to have it last six years, and I figured I'd buy another (even after buying two other Invictas in between).
customer_reviews.author: PE

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: This watch doesn't work..it work like for 15 mins then stop. Now I cant return because return window close July 4. I spent over $80 for this . I am so mad with this seller
customer_reviews.author: candice

customer_reviews.title: Decent watch for the money. . .
customer_reviews.text: I am a intermediate watch guy. I buy Seiko automatics and movados. That's the extent of my collection. Until I added this watch. It is a solid construction. But the li ks in the bracket feel hollow. The gold is plated. And between the links when you inspect it you can see the playing fade out there the bezel the face and the see through backing are similar to my Seiko Kenitic Windward two tone. All around it's a decent watch for less than what I paid for my Seiko but uses the companies movement.
customer_reviews.author: John Raymond Cummings Jr

customer_reviews.title: Well made watch
customer_reviews.text: Best automatic watch I've owned, keeps accurate time' and hands luminous at night. found no issue with water as long as you secure crown to stay water proof. Does look like a Rolex Submariner, but is a very nice watch on it's own. Will be buying another automatic from Invicta soon.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Seekatz

customer_reviews.title: High end for low end price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected. After size adjustment, the fit was good but could be better. This particular Invicta was not as comfortable as the Zeus or as visually striking, but still an attractive watch. Be ready to receive many compliments. I have always wanted a watch with a luxurious feel containing silver,gold, and blue color combination with automatic movement . This is a very high end and good quality watch at a very practical price.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Invicta Watch
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and attractive watch . After 45 days a small pin on the latch of the bracelet broke and could no longer keep watch on wrist. Upon contacting Invicta for service, was told that the pin would not qualify for warranty repair even though fairly new. Could be a quantity sold is more important than quality of product. Never had that problem with Timex. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Boltenhouse

customer_reviews.title: Invicta Men's 8928OB
customer_reviews.text: Had this watch for over 2 yrs ..Do not hold it time every two week have to adjust it..Also strap is not a good quality one of the pins that hold it together slide out so strap is no more good..would not buy from this product brand supplies again
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: I can’t answer as to the Water Resistance yet or scratch resistance. It’s too new! But for the price and feel this is a nice time piece. I own a Rolex, and it’s getting some TLC at the moment, and something was needed to get by. This again seems to be an accurate well made time piece and for the money, I can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: GoodOl Boy

customer_reviews.title: Quite a nice watch
customer_reviews.text: Came well packaged, a slight bit of damage to the box but It wasn't really a concern of mine. It's a nice homage watch but was a tad big for my wrist. I ended up getting a few links taken out. It is a few seconds quick. A little bummed that it went on sale a few days after I purchased it but overall I really love it. I've always been happy with the Invicta Watches that Iv'e purchased.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value- Looks and feels like a Rolex
customer_reviews.text: This timepiece is stunning. I used to sell Rolex watches and so I wasn't quite sure how this watch would look and feel considering that it's similar in style to a Datejust. This watch does not disappoint! The weight is impressive & the look and feel is very high end. I am so pleased with this watch. This was a gift for my Dad for his birthday and he was extremely excited about it. Do not hesitate--- buy this watch.
customer_reviews.author: AC Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Really great watch for a fantastic value
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely pleased with this watch. I own many watches and this one looks better and keeps better time than my other self- winders. I would say it is easily worth 4 times the price. The date is very easy to read with the magnifying bubble. I have a problem reading dates on my other watches with my old eyes, but not on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Zygster

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This item is absolutely the best value of any watch that I viewed on Amazon. I took the time to research a lot before investing in a quality timepiece (I am not in the economic class to purchase a Tag or Rolex), and after looking through many product reviews and ratings, I finally settled on this. I am glad I did, the construction is solid as a brick, and it feels about as heavy as the more pricey pieces. The movement is wonderful and precise and aesthetically is it beautiful to look at. If you need a good looking watch for any occasion, buy this and you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Just An Average Guy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t keep time and isn’t water resistant.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this watch and it looked real beautiful and looked very expensive. I thought it was a steal at $80. Do not buy it though. It does not keep time. It isn’t water resistant. I cleaned dishes with it on and it had water in it. I must have got a defective watch.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and working watch
customer_reviews.text: This watch is top notch. No it does not have the fit and finish of a Rolex Submariner but it doesn't have the $12000 price tag either. You can wear this watch and have all the enjoyment of a quality time piece with out worrying about scuffs and scratches. For the price you are getting one hell of a watch. Invicta gets a bad rap for what I'm not sure, maybe it's because the people that spend the $12000 for a Submariner wish they had found this first. To each his own, but for me this is the bee's knees.
customer_reviews.author: william j. robinson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but not good
customer_reviews.text: The watch is good looking and keeps decent time. The power reserve is awful and if you go more than a few hours without wearing it you will be resetting the watch. Now seven months after buying the inside of the crystal fogs with any significant change in temp or humidity. Not exactly what one would expect from a "pro" dive watch.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bell

customer_reviews.title: QC lacking
customer_reviews.text: The watch i received was unable to set the time or date due to crown mechanism being out of alingnment. Every time you would set the time on the second position the first position to adjust date would be where the crown threads already engaged would mess up both date and time. I would stay away from this how can that problem pass through QC.
customer_reviews.author: Jose B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Watch
customer_reviews.text: Update: Hunk-a-junk. I can no longer set the date after only wearing it about 5 different times. Just got the watch today but man, is it nice! The dial does have a purple gleam to it when the light hits it just right. No worries here though. It definitely makes a nice addition to the collection.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking
customer_reviews.text: This watch was a nice addition to my collection, looks like a Rolex, nice looking, easy to read, appears well made, it is heavier than most watches. As with other watches removing the pins to remove the links was not easy but doable.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Watch would not keep time. It was set and ...
customer_reviews.text: Watch would not keep time. It was set and an hour later was 20 minutes ahead. I thought I perhaps had made a mistake and reset it. In another hour it was 15 minutes off Immediately returned... Went to Stauer and bought similar watch.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Kron

customer_reviews.title: Should be five stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my older Invicta that was stolen. The police wanted a serial number for my stolen Invicta and I had nuttin' so when this watch came I went looking for the serial number. Can't find one. Nothing specific about this watch beyond the model. 8928OB that's it. As far as I can tell. I do like the Invicta line of watches and I like this one. Nice watch. No serial number. Don't let it get stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Curtiss B.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful! Great dressed up or casual because it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful! Great dressed up or casual because it is two tone and has that captivating shade of blue. Have not owned it long enough to say if the blue chips off the dial or not as a couple others reported. The blue is so handsome, my husband loves this watch! So far it keeps good time, but he is wearing it daily, which we understood helps it keep correct time; it is easy to change the date and time, nice weight and size and the jewler was able to remove two links for fit. Fabulous price compared to many other sources.
customer_reviews.author: Napsil

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Invicta watch
customer_reviews.text: This is my second invicta watch. Replaced metal bracelet with Barton nato leather strap. Picture shows this one and my other invicta with black gray James Bond strap. Both watches recommended. Shown on watch winder I also got from Amazon.com
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Stellar!
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my dad and he loved it. The watch is one of those, he only wears when he gets dressed up. The blue is a nice touch. The tones of gold and silver blends very well with the blue.the watch is very sleek but not fancy.
customer_reviews.author: John Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but junk with lousy warranty
customer_reviews.text: Crown fell out after 32 days, No Amazon return allowed, and Invicta doesn't cover the crown under warranty, costs 28$ plus my shipping just to get an estimate to fix. Better off buying a new one, which I probably won't Looks great though.......
customer_reviews.author: Skydog

customer_reviews.title: Still great quality
customer_reviews.text: Looks exactly like a Rolex but much easier on the pocket. Keeps time very accurate, but scratches easy. Only wear it going out to dinner or to the country club and already have quite a few marks on the band. Still highly recommended and a great piece to have in a collection
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Bates

customer_reviews.title: you get a very good Rolex look-alike
customer_reviews.text: First of all let me admit for what you are paying, you get a very good Rolex look-alike. Half the cost of an annual genuine Rolex servicing. Like a real Rolex, it doesn't keep great time even if wound a lot. The crystal, especially the part over the date, is easily scratched as is the band itself. The worst part is that mine completely died October 28, 2015 or 18 months after purchasing. Still, I ordered a new one for the reasons in the first sentence above. Just don't expect a high quality watch.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of negative reviews about this company, however most of them were with the rubber or material bands, I have had this watch a week, kept it wound, and worn 3 times. Has kept great time, looks great, feels great, and 2 people told me the did not know I had a Rolex. Comes in a beautiful box, that I use when not worn. Fast shipping. So impressed I bought my college roommate from the late 70's one for his 51st birthday. He was blown away, thinking I had spent thousands on him. Little did he know. He actually texted me this morning and said he got "another" compliment on his.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great looking watch with some short comings
customer_reviews.text: This watch is looks great. Things to consider are: 1 - It's heavy. Not terrible but worth being aware of. 2 - The band has lots of extra links that will have to be removed. Check YouTube. Great "how to videos". 3 - This watch is a manual wind. If you don't wear it, it will stop in about 3 days. 4 - The calendar date has 31 days and will require readjusting on short months. When something looks so good you may have to live with some short comings.
customer_reviews.author: NiskyALP

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY INVICTA PRODUCTS
customer_reviews.text: Had problems with this watch, called Invicta because there is a 1 year warranty. They had me ship the watch to their service center and promptly emailed me a bill to repair the watch that is under warranty. Every time you call to speak to them, you are on hold for over an hour to get through. 2 words for Invicta, Never Again. The quality product is crap and the quality of the service is even worse.
customer_reviews.author: afriestec

customer_reviews.title: People will want to see this watch everywhere you go, great value!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, just wow. As someone who is passionate about watches but is broke as a joke, I can say that this blew me away in terms of the quality to price ratio. What an absolute beauty this watch is, and with a seiko auto movement for less than $100?! If you've even considered this watch, jump all over it. I will be purchasing the entire lineup of the pro and grand diver series, what gems.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Taylor

product_meta.title: Invicta Men's 8928OB Pro Diver Gold Stainless Steel Two-Tone Automatic Watch
product_meta.description:
Invicta, Pro Diver, Men's Watch, Stainless Steel and Yellow Gold Plated Case, Stainless Steel and Yellow Gold Plated Bracelet, Mechanical Automatic (Self-Winding), 8928C

Classic styling and high performance add up to an outstanding sport watch for your land or sea adventures. This two-tone automatic watch, from Invicta's Pro Diver series, places a large round stainless steel case on a robust steel bracelet with gold-plated center links. The electric blue dial is designed for quick and easy read-off, even in low light conditions. It offers three-hand function with luminous hands and markers and a magnified date display at the three o'clock position. The detailed hands, in Mercedes, sword, and breguet-style logo shapes, add a note of distinction. The dial is capped with a resilient mineral crystal and framed by a blue unidirectional rotating steel bezel with goldtone markings and coin edge detailing. This watch is driven by a Japanese automatic movement, which is visible through the see-through skeleton case back. It is rated water resistant to a full 200 meters. 



Pro Diver Collection

Plunge into any horizon using the steadfast guidance of the Invicta Pro Diver. Stylishly classic, internal workings are forged with variations of either Swiss chronograph or 21-jewel automatic movements and willingly navigate in depths up to 300 meters. Built with confident prowess, the fortitude with which these timepieces function makes the Pro Diver the quintessential in performance.



Automatic Watches

Automatic watches do not operate on batteries. Automatic watches are made up of about 130 or more parts that work together to tell time. Automatic movements mark the passage of time by a series of gear mechanisms, and are wound by the movement of your wrist as you wear it. The gear train then transmits the power to the escapement, which distributes the impulses, turning the balance wheel. The balance wheel is the time regulating organ of a mechanical watch, which vibrates on a spiral hairspring. Lengthening or shortening the balance spring makes the balance wheel go faster or slower to advance or retard the watch. The travel of the balance wheel from one extreme to the other and back again is called oscillation. Lastly, automatic movements come in different types, including movements that are Swiss-made, Japanese-made, and more.

Also referred to as self-winding, watches with automatic movements utilize kinetic energy, the swinging of your arm, to provide energy to an oscillating rotor to keep the watch ticking. They're considered more satisfying to watch collectors (horologists) because of the engineering artistry that goes into the hundreds of parts that make up the movement. If you do not wear an automatic watch consistently (for about 8 to 12 hours a day), you can keep the watch powered with a watch winder (a great gift for collectors).







With its most inspired creations yet, Invicta demonstrates its technical and design prowess, offering timepieces of style for extreme value.

"We have long held firm to the belief that supremely crafted timepieces can be offered for extremely modest sums. It is the founding principle of our flagship and the radical notion that still drives us today. By being true to our convictions, we will continue to turn the balance of power, and deliver true Swiss luxury to anyone who desires it. Let all those who possess our timepieces and pass through our doors witness the quality, value and care in every piece we create, and the spirit of never-ending possibilities in everything we do."

These are the words that greet visitors and motivate team members inside the Invicta Watch Group's new worldwide headquarters. Emblazoned in stainless steel, it has been the Invicta message since Day One.

 With each new timepiece, the company sends up a flare for those looking to be defined not by how much they spend, but how wisely they spend. With its strong collections, the gutsy Swiss brand is guaranteed to keep attracting followers. 

It takes years of training and a great deal of pride to achieve glorious Swiss timepieces by hand. But it takes guts and the courage of your convictions to make those timepieces affordable for everyone who appreciates them.

 At our Swiss workshops, we mix time-honored traditions with a little bit of horse sense every single day to produce the greatest values in the watch-making world. 



See more 


PRODUCT DETAILS
 *  user guide [PDF ] User Manual Manual [PDF ] Sample Case Size Cutout [PDF 214kb] For additional assistance in setting the time or adjusting your watch, please download the Instruction Manual [PDF 425kb] 
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :0.59 x 0.59 x 0.59 inches; 8.82 Ounces
 * Item model number :8928OB
 * Department :Mens
 * Batteries :1 Lithium Metal batteries required.
 * Date First Available :March 22, 2004
 * Manufacturer :Invicta
 * ASIN :B000JQJS6M

 * .zg_hrsr_item {list-style : none};
 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #31,089 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #110 inMen's Wrist Watches 
    *  #7896 inMen's Shops 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.4 out of 5 stars6,725 ratings Invicta, Pro Diver, Men's Watch, Stainless Steel and Yellow Gold Plated Case, Stainless Steel and Yellow Gold Plated Bracelet, Mechanical Automatic (Self-Winding), 8928C

Let all those who possess our timepieces and pass through our doors witness the quality, value and care in every piece we create, and the spirit of never-ending possibilities in everything we do."

These are the words that greet visitors and motivate team members inside the Invicta Watch Group's new worldwide headquarters. Emblazoned in stainless steel, it has been the Invicta message since Day One.

It takes years of training and a great deal of pride to achieve glorious Swiss timepieces by hand. But it takes guts and the courage of your convictions to make those timepieces affordable for everyone who appreciates them.

 At our Swiss workshops, we mix time-honored traditions with a little bit of horse sense every single day to produce the greatest values in the watch-making world. 



See more
feature_bullets: Round watch featuring corrugated unidirectional bezel, luminous hands/markers, and magnified date window at 3 o'clock
Japanese automatic movement with analog display
Gold & Stainless steel tone bracelet with foldover clasp with safety closure
